channel.title: Take Off
channel.description:
A series from Hungary, featuring students' stories as well as classics like The Catcher in the Rye and Breakfast at Tiffany's.Theme music by Kartali Laszlo. To send a story or comment: email me.
My podcast feed and all episodes available at: http://jozsefhor.podomatic.com.
Take Off blog: http://take-o-f-f.blogspot.com.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Stories by students and classics
channel.itunes:author: Jozsef Horvath
channel.itunes:summary:
A series from Hungary, featuring students' stories as well as classics like The Catcher in the Rye and Breakfast at Tiffany's.Theme music by Kartali Laszlo. To send a story or comment: email me.
My podcast feed and all episodes available at: http://jozsefhor.podomatic.com.
Take Off blog: http://take-o-f-f.blogspot.com.

item.title: Take Off 77: Afterlife Pleasantries
item.description: Listen to a story written, performed and produced by Éliás Zoltán, a student at the University of Pécs, Hungary. Music composed by the author.
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary: Listen to a story written, performed and produced by Éliás Zoltán, a student at the University of Pécs, Hungary. Music composed by the author.

item.title: Take Off 75: Adán Reyes from Mexico City
item.description: Adán Reyes talks about his work as a chemist at the National Autonomous University of México, that special tool, the glovebox, and those amazing volcanoes, Popocatépetl and Iztaccihuatl. Music credit: from the Mahahual Music podcast. Please note that the first 20 episodes are available from me directly from now on as I had to delete them from Podomatic to make space for the new episodes. Send me email at jozsefhor@gmail.com if you need some of those episodes.
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary:
Adán Reyes talks about his work as a chemist at the National Autonomous University of México, that special tool, the glovebox, and those amazing volcanoes, Popocatépetl and Iztaccihuatl.
Music credit: from the Mahahual Music podcast.
Please note that the first 20 episodes are available from me directly from now on as I had to delete them from Podomatic to make space for the new episodes. Send me email at jozsefhor@gmail.com if you need some of those episodes.

item.title: Take Off 74: Barna and Tibi About Ebooks
item.description: Two students, Barna and Tibi, managers at the Power Plant in Pécs, discussed views about ebooks in a recent class with me. A segment from that session.
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary: Two students, Barna and Tibi, managers at the Power Plant in Pécs, discussed views about ebooks in a recent class with me. A segment from that session.

item.title: Take Off 73: Evi, the Information Assistant
item.description: Evi is an information assistant, available on iPhones and Android phones. I got the app a few days ago and tested what it can do. It? She? You decide.
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary: Evi is an information assistant, available on iPhones and Android phones. I got the app a few days ago and tested what it can do. It? She? You decide.

item.title: Take Off 72: Of Michael Jackson and the Moon
item.description: Six stories in this episode: five by high-school students who were among the visitors on our open day at the University of Pécs today, and one by Fülöp Eper Flóra, a second-year English major. The high-school authors: László Gábor, Decsi Liliána, Vörös László, Babos Tamás and Ferenczi Ágota.
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary: Six stories in this episode: five by high-school students who were among the visitors on our open day at the University of Pécs today, and one by Fülöp Eper Flóra, a second-year English major. The high-school authors: László Gábor, Decsi Liliána, Vörös László, Babos Tamás and Ferenczi Ágota.

item.title: Take Off 71: American Anthony
item.description: The last episode in 2011 features Anthony Krese, a.k.a. American Anthony, a teacher in Japan. Snippets from our Skype chat. Anthony's website: www.americananthony.com
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary:
The last episode in 2011 features Anthony Krese, a.k.a. American Anthony, a teacher in Japan. Snippets from our Skype chat.
Anthony's website: www.americananthony.com

item.title: Take Off 70: Skype Chat with Thékes István
item.description: Seventy episodes already! Listen to a chat with language educator and PhD student Thékes István, also known as Jerry Thékes. Technical background info: episode recorded on the iPhone 4, partly mixed and edited with the GarageBand app, also on the iPhone. Look for more tweaks and programming innovations as a result of this app in the future. Theme music by Kartali László. Acoustic guitar riffs by Horváth József
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary:
Seventy episodes already!
Listen to a chat with language educator and PhD student Thékes István, also known as Jerry Thékes.
Technical background info: episode recorded on the iPhone 4, partly mixed and edited with the GarageBand app, also on the iPhone. Look for more tweaks and programming innovations as a result of this app in the future.

item.title: Take Off 69: Part 2 of the Interview with Kathy
item.description:
Part 2 of the interview with Katharine Whitcomb.
Kathy's website: http://www.katharinewhitcomb.com
This episode was first released a week ago but was then mysteriously gone for a day. Hope this time it will be okay.
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary:
Part 2 of the interview with Katharine Whitcomb.
Kathy's website: http://www.katharinewhitcomb.com
This episode was first released a week ago but was then mysteriously gone for a day. Hope this time it will be okay.

item.title: Take Off 68: An Afternoon with Katharine Whitcomb
item.description: Katharine Whitcomb is associate professor at Central Washington University. Currently she is guest professor at the University of Pécs. A poet and collaborative artist, she is also a great person to listen to. This episode is the first of a two-part series featuring her ideas and poetry. Her website: http://www.katharinewhitcomb.com Music credit: "Gone In" by Everyday Jones Theme music composed and played by Kartali László
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary:
Katharine Whitcomb is associate professor at Central Washington University. Currently she is guest professor at the University of Pécs. A poet and collaborative artist, she is also a great person to listen to. This episode is the first of a two-part series featuring her ideas and poetry.
Her website: http://www.katharinewhitcomb.com
Music credit: "Gone In" by Everyday Jones
Theme music composed and played by Kartali László

item.title: Take Off 67: Eper to Fly to Texas
item.description: Fülöp Eper Flóra about her upcoming work experience in a Texas summer camp. Music credit: Blake Shelton's "Nobody But Me."
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary: Fülöp Eper Flóra about her upcoming work experience in a Texas summer camp. Music credit: Blake Shelton's "Nobody But Me."

item.title: Take Off 66: Hana Humpolíková from Ostrava
item.description: Hana Humpolíková is a student from Ostrava, the Czech Republic, currently on an Erasmus scholarship at the University of Pécs. The other day, we got together in my office.
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary: Hana Humpolíková is a student from Ostrava, the Czech Republic, currently on an Erasmus scholarship at the University of Pécs. The other day, we got together in my office.

item.title: Take Off 65: Anna Back from Madrid
item.description: Rudolf Anna came back from Madrid to Pécs for a short visit last week. After a hot chocolate and coffee, we went to Széchenyi square to record an interview.
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary: Rudolf Anna came back from Madrid to Pécs for a short visit last week. After a hot chocolate and coffee, we went to Széchenyi square to record an interview.

item.title: Take Off 64: Sounds
item.description: You can listen to a sound story -- and not only that. You can write it, too! Send entries to jozsefhor@gmail.com.
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary: You can listen to a sound story -- and not only that. You can write it, too! Send entries to jozsefhor@gmail.com.

item.title: Take Off 63: Katarina on Writing, Words and Photos
item.description: Katarina Vesela, a colleague from Slovakia, speaks about her recently published book, Academic Writing, among others.
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary: Katarina Vesela, a colleague from Slovakia, speaks about her recently published book, Academic Writing, among others.

item.title: Take Off 62: Three Students from A Coruna
item.description:
Horváth Bálint, Fekecs Adrienn and Szilas Péter, three good friends from the University of Pécs, are studying at A Coruna, Spain this semester. Last week they came to chat with me. This episode: soundbites fom our chat.

Please note that due to bandwidth limitations, some of my podcast episodes may not be available at the beginning of November. If you hear a Podomatic rep saying that my monthly bandwidth has expired, don't abandon Take Off: on November 4, my counter will be reset and all the episodes will be back on the air.
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary: Horváth Bálint, Fekecs Adrienn and Szilas Péter, three good friends from the University of Pécs, are studying at A Coruna, Spain this semester. Last week they came to chat with me. This episode: soundbites fom our chat. Please note that due to bandwidth limitations, some of my podcast episodes may not be available at the beginning of November. If you hear a Podomatic rep saying that my monthly bandwidth has expired, don't abandon Take Off: on November 4, my counter will be reset and all the episodes will be back on the air.

item.description: Second-year MA student Kovács Gabi tells us about her blog at http://kovgab.wordpress.com

item.itunes:summary: Second-year MA student Kovács Gabi tells us about her blog at http://kovgab.wordpress.com

item.title: Take Off 60: Sonia Valdiviezo on Her Novel
item.description: First we talked, and then we danced -- at the farewell party at Seggau Castle, Austria. Find out about Sonia Valdiviezo's novel-in-progress.
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary: First we talked, and then we danced -- at the farewell party at Seggau Castle, Austria. Find out about Sonia Valdiviezo's novel-in-progress.

item.description: I met Jonathan at this year's Graz University Summer School. Snippets from an interview we recorded on the last day.
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary: I met Jonathan at this year's Graz University Summer School. Snippets from an interview we recorded on the last day.

item.title: Take Off 58: Lovorka and Vladimir in Pécs
item.description: My Croatian colleagues, Lovorka Zergollern-Miletic and Vladimir Legac, and I went to have beer in Pécs yesterday. Guess who turned on his iPhone. Episode track: "Two Lessons to Learn" by Thalassa. More Thalassa music at http://www.ilike.com

item.title: Take Off 57: The Immortal Jellyfish
item.description:
An article by Bryan Nelson about the only animal known to be immortal, the turritopsis nutricula. See text at http://bit.ly/93JXXO
Episode track: "Mystique" by Marcin Borowski. Browse more Borowski music at http://www.ilike.com

Episode celebrates 55th milestone with a classic grotesque article from The Onion.

item.title: Take Off 53: Taking Off with Szvath Dóra
item.description:
Second-year student and two-time Blog Oscar Award winner Szvath Dóra narrates a passage from her short story, "Passengers." The full story is on her blog: http://senator888.blogspot.com
Theme music by Kartali László

item.title: Take Off 52: Ian Frazier on Phones and Dogs
item.description:
An excerpt of a feature from the October 19, 2009 issue of The New Yorker.
Theme music by Kartali Lacek. Episode track: "Lions," by The Features.

item.itunes:summary:
An excerpt of a feature from the October 19, 2009 issue of The New Yorker.

item.title: Take Off 51: Iveszics Alexander's Essay
item.description: "I’m not saying that it’s alright to be nervous all the time, but helping stressed-out people is always better than scolding them." This idea and more in Alexander's essay. Theme tune by Kartali László. Music credit: Robyn Hitchcock and The Venus
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary:
"I’m not saying that it’s alright to be nervous all the time, but helping stressed-out people is always better than scolding them." This idea and more in Alexander's essay.
Theme tune by Kartali László. Music credit: Robyn Hitchcock and The Venus

item.title: Take Off 50: Voices from the Past
item.description:
Kartali Laci is the composer and musician of the new theme tune. Tune in to listen to that and to seven people from the first 49 episodes: Dani, Bernadett, Gergő, Steve, Lovorka, Anna, and Scott.
After this episode was published, Take Off really took off: it moved to 491st place overall. That's not bad with over 30,000 other podcasts trailing behind on Podomatic!
Thanks for listening!
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath

Thanks for listening!

item.title: Take Off 49: Bernadett and Attila Comment on Podcasts
item.description: Józsa Bernadett and Hudák Attila talk about two podcasts: Take Off and Tokyo Calling, the latter by my favorite podcaster, Scott Lockmann. Music credit: "Melt Down the Knives" by Sin Fang Bous.

item.itunes:summary: Józsa Bernadett and Hudák Attila talk about two podcasts: Take Off and Tokyo Calling, the latter by my favorite podcaster, Scott Lockmann. Music credit: "Melt Down the Knives" by Sin Fang Bous.

item.title: Take Off 48: Chat with Carol MacCurdy
item.description: Fulbright Professor Carol MacCurdy and I went to Paulus last week, and I asked her to talk about life and literature in the US. Snippets from the chat.

item.itunes:summary: Fulbright Professor Carol MacCurdy and I went to Paulus last week, and I asked her to talk about life and literature in the US. Snippets from the chat.

item.description: Seven students from my Oral Presentation Skills course share opinions and plans: Balázs, Anita, Kitti, Kinga, Anna, Judit, and Krisztián.

item.title: Take Off 40: Meeting Would-Be Freshmen
item.description: First, some thoughts about meeting would-be freshmen last Saturday, and then a song by Cargo Cult. Photo: Zsélyi Eszter after our talk, with part of Kungl Zsófi's blog showing in the background.

item.title: Take Off 39: Reports by Sziszi, Angéla, István and Eszter
item.description: A nameday, an exhibition, a trip and a song: four students share their experiences on their blogs. Music credit: Michael Halaas, http://www.ilike.com

item.title: Take Off 38: Stories by Dóri, Évi and Lilla
item.description: Three blogs, three stories, three students: Szvath Dóra, Balázs Éva and Gazdóf Lilla. Music credit: a song by Ellen Says No, a free MP3 download from http://www.ilike.com/artist/Ellen+Says+No

item.title: Take Off 37: Amsterdam Calling
item.description: Kartali László, third-year student of Pécs, jazz musician, vocabulary master, and composer of the Take Off theme music, calls Amsterdam home this semester that he spends in Holland on an Erasmus scholarship. In this episode, we share a part of our Skype chat last weekend. Photo credit: Lacek's photo of the view form his apartment in downtown Amsterdam.
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary: Kartali László, third-year student of Pécs, jazz musician, vocabulary master, and composer of the Take Off theme music, calls Amsterdam home this semester that he spends in Holland on an Erasmus scholarship. In this episode, we share a part of our Skype chat last weekend. Photo credit: Lacek's photo of the view form his apartment in downtown Amsterdam.

item.title: Take Off 36: Five Students Start Blogs
item.description:
The site is up and running again! Enjoy these podcasts!
Listen to the first posts of Andrea, Dóra, Zsófi, Kornél, and Krisztián. I am planning more episodes featuring students' blogs this semester. If you would like to read these and other blog posts, go to http://take-o-f-f.blogspot.com and look for the list.

item.itunes:summary:
The site is up and running again! Enjoy these podcasts!

item.title: Take Off 35: Last Vacation Episode
item.description: The last summer episode this year!
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary: The last summer episode this year!

item.title: Take Off 34: Find the River with REM
item.description: In just a little more than a day, I'll be there with the crowd watching and listening to REM at the Sziget, Budapest, Hungary. I hope to be back from that concert with a special REM Live edition of the podcast. We'll see. What's sure is that the most recent episode features "Find the River." #rembudapest
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary: In just a little more than a day, I'll be there with the crowd watching and listening to REM at the Sziget, Budapest, Hungary. I hope to be back from that concert with a special REM Live edition of the podcast. We'll see. What's sure is that the most recent episode features "Find the River." #rembudapest

item.title: Take Off 33: Frank Mills from Hair
item.description: That's right: this week, the lyrics comes from that 60s musical, Hair. Enjoy!
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary: That's right: this week, the lyrics comes from that 60s musical, Hair. Enjoy!

item.title: Take Off 32: Accelerate with REM
item.description:
How about shifting into sixth gear with this fantastic track from REM's latest album? Plus listen to my rendition of the lyrics. Enjoy! Also, check out Take Off after the REM concert on the Sziget on August 16. I will be there and share with you some of the highlights of the show!
#rembudapest
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary:
How about shifting into sixth gear with this fantastic track from REM's latest album? Plus listen to my rendition of the lyrics. Enjoy! Also, check out Take Off after the REM concert on the Sziget on August 16. I will be there and share with you some of the highlights of the show!
#rembudapest

item.description: The first summer episode! Enjoy your vacation and this story, the lyrics of Coldplay's Viva La Vida.

item.itunes:summary: The first summer episode! Enjoy your vacation and this story, the lyrics of Coldplay's Viva La Vida.

item.title: Take Off 30: Toronto, Starlight, and Zamárdi
item.description: Konkoly Kriszta, Horváth Bálint, and Szilas Péter, three English majors at the University of Pécs, talk about an exam and their summer plans.
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary: Konkoly Kriszta, Horváth Bálint, and Szilas Péter, three English majors at the University of Pécs, talk about an exam and their summer plans.

item.title: Take Off 29: After the Conference
item.description: Lovorka Zergollern - Miletic, a colleague from the University of Zagreb, and I gave a talk on coherence and originality in student writing at a Pécs conference last week. After the presentation, we went to have a glass of wine downtown -- together with a team of participants. It was there that I made this recording. The song is by The Agape Rose. Find more great music by them and other bands at www.ilike.com.
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary:
Lovorka Zergollern - Miletic, a colleague from the University of Zagreb, and I gave a talk on coherence and originality in student writing at a Pécs conference last week. After the presentation, we went to have a glass of wine downtown -- together with a team of participants. It was there that I made this recording.
The song is by The Agape Rose. Find more great music by them and other bands at www.ilike.com.

item.title: Take Off 28: On the Terrace of Paulus
item.description:
Kosóczki Kata, Buda Réka and Fodor Balázs, three students from my Oral Presentation Skills II course, are talking about Forster's novel, A Passage to India, and another passage.
The song is "Sol naciente" by Cargo Cult. Go to http://www.ilike.com to listen to songs by them or other GarageBand musicians.

item.title: Take Off 27: Stephen Spinder's Stories
item.description: In the past three years, I have met Steve four times: at the annual Budapest Folk Dance Festivals. This past weekend I asked him to tell Take Off a little bit about his interest in things Hungarian and Transylvanian. Here's the cover photo of his album Ten Years in Transylvania: If you would like to see Steve's other photos, too, visit his site at http://www.spinderartphoto.com/
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary:
In the past three years, I have met Steve four times: at the annual Budapest Folk Dance Festivals. This past weekend I asked him to tell Take Off a little bit about his interest in things Hungarian and Transylvanian.
Here's the cover photo of his album Ten Years in Transylvania:
If you would like to see Steve's other photos, too, visit his site at
http://www.spinderartphoto.com/

item.title: Take Off 26: The Untouchables
item.description:
A scene from the movie starring Sean Connery and Kevin Costner, plus a conversation with Rácz Krisztián.
The song is by the Mitchell Blues Band -- a free MP3 file from www.iLike.com

item.title: Take Off 25: Easter Island by Katherine Routledge
item.description: In this episode I read a passage about the prehistoric statues on Easter Island. Read the rest of the chapter and other sections in Routledge's book on Google Books: http://books.google.com/books?id=36yi7JgoBY8C&rview=1
item.dc:creator: Jozsef Horvath
item.itunes:summary: In this episode I read a passage about the prehistoric statues on Easter Island. Read the rest of the chapter and other sections in Routledge's book on Google Books: http://books.google.com/books?id=36yi7JgoBY8C&rview=1

item.title: Take Off 24: Through the Glasses of... By Rudolf Anna
item.description:
Listen to Rudolf Anna's story from her blog at http://anchuk.blogspot.com
The singer featured in the episode is Hannah Ild.

item.title: Take Off 23: Krupla Gergo About Reading and Writing

item.title: Take Off 21: Nikolov Marianne on Vocabulary Learning
item.description: Another rerun of a segment from a Joe and Co. episode from last year, featuring Marianne's ideas about learning vocabulary. The music for this episode is by Everyday Jones, What I'm Missing. Used under the Creative Commons license. You can hear more Everyday Jones songs at http://www.podsafeaudio.com.
